2.text: Heat the butter in a skillet until it sizzles.

3.text: Put the sliced onions into the skillet gradually and add a pinch of salt.

4.text: Cook the onions for 15 to 20 minutes for lightly caramelized onions.

5.text: Sauté the onions for 15 to 30 more minutes if you want darker onions.

6.text: Use the caramelized onions in dips, pasta, or eggs.

7.text: Stir in balsamic and brown sugar for a richer flavor.

8.text: Simmer the onions in beer or cider to create thicker caramelized onions.

9.text: Stir in a pinch of baking soda to speed up caramelization.

10.text: Add thyme for a slight herbal flavor.

11.text: Caramelize the onions in a slow cooker for a hands-off method.
